Posts.Content: Sounds like she is getting good care and advice! I am on a similar plan.
Posts.Title: Cutting edge treatments and clinical trials for Stage IV Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: my oncologist doesn't use the work remission any more. They say NED instead. No Evidence of Disease. I don't think I am in that category, because I am only good as long as the treatments are working. So far I have been three years since the Stage 4 Diagnosis and doing great. There are a lot of people on this site who have been free for much longer than that. I had some small side effects at the beginning, but I think my body has adapted and I don't have side effects (SE) and more.! Good luck to you and your daughter!
Posts.Title: Cutting edge treatments and clinical trials for Stage IV Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: I agree... "Stable" is the good word they use for me all the time. I am happy with "Stable"
Posts.Title: Cutting edge treatments and clinical trials for Stage IV Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: I'm not on the same meds that you are. I am on Ibrance, Faslodex and Xgeva.. Manageing side effects will be a new project for you. There seems to be something for everything. I had mouth sores in the first months and got a perscription for "Magic Mouthwash" from the pharmacist. My body seems to have adjusted, because I don't get them any more. I have stocked up on SolanPas Pain patches when they are on sale at Costco. My pains come at night...and I slap on a pain patch and take some advil. I have sleep problems many nights. My primary care gave me Elavil for anxiety and to help sleep. We Don't want a "sleeping Pill" because I already have fatigue during the day,.. Nausea...I have only occasionally, but the doctor gave me a pill for that. My point is: take each side effect as it comes and it might even go away. You will get through the side effects. God Bless!
Posts.Title: Any input would help

Posts.Content: That's awesome! Thank you very much for sharing. I have been on IBrance and Faslodex with Xgeva since June 2016. I love this combination for me.
Posts.Title: Switching to Verzenio after Ibrance

Posts.Content: I had a breast cancer tumor in my left lung three years ago and eleven years after my first Stage 2 breast cancer diagnosis. I am ER & PR positive and Her2 neg. Over the first year on Ibrance, Faslodex & Xgeva that tumor shrank and now has been totally gone for the last two years. I am sorry you have had to go through so much. Have hope, they keep coming up with new therapies and results are better than they thought. Prayers for you.
Posts.Title: anyone with a secondary breast cancer in lungs ?

Posts.Content: I am so sorry that you have been diagnosed with this disease. There are so many treatments to help you "manage" breast cancer. I will add you to my prayers, Grace! I have found great comfort in this site for the last 2 1/2 years, I think you will too. God Bless you! Cathy
